item.title: Lessons From Six Years of Applied Machine Learning in Industry
item.description: It’s been more than six years since I started working in industry doing Machine Learning. I wanted to delve a bit deeper into my experience and what I have seen as differences between academic research (PhD) and applied research/data science. Below, I describe six lessons I have learned. 1. I don’t have the time to do all the experiments I would like. When trying to get your research published, there are many experiments you need to perform.
